alert.note: Alert for Gove; Graham; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Sheridan, Graham and northeastern Gove Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Morland, or 7 miles southwest of Hill City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hill City around 625 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 100 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
